senses.sense_definition: An Italian liqueur flavored with anise or elderberries, traditionally served with three coffee beans.

examples.text: The bartender poured a shot of <w>sambuca</w> into a small glass.
She enjoys drinking <w>sambuca</w> with three coffee beans floating on top.

senses.sense_definition: An ancient triangular stringed instrument with a sharp tone, similar to a harp.

examples.text: The musician plucked the strings of the <w>sambuca</w> during the ancient festival.
Historians describe the <w>sambuca</w> as having a shrill and piercing sound.

senses.sense_definition: An ancient military siege engine mounted on ships, used to scale walls.

examples.text: The Roman fleet used a <w>sambuca</w> to attack the coastal fortress.
Soldiers climbed the ladder of the <w>sambuca</w> to reach the top of the enemy wall.
